page.title: 07OLD RAILWAY
page.content: The old railway line opened in 1856. It was planned to help with transport for coal and iron but it was too late,as the iron works had closed in 1846.The line was extended in 1862 to join the Carlisle to Hawick line so people could travel into Scotland. The line closed in 1956 to the disappointment of the people who now rely on road transport only.Now the old track can be seen creeping across the landscape, sometimes reclaimed by farmers for grazing and in other places left to grow wild. Older local people miss the old railway.It went past a row of houses.On show day they used to wave to the passengers as they arrived in hundreds from the towns. There were four trains a day taking people on outings to Newcastle and Edinburgh or to school in Hexham.
